chapter_title: KEEP OTHERS IN SUSPENDED TERROR: CULTIVATE AN AIR OF UNPREDICTABILITY
summary: Law 17 emphasizes the importance of unpredictability in maintaining power over others. Predictable behavior gives people a sense of control, while your unexpected actions can leave them unsettled and confused. The story of Bobby Fischer reveals how his unconventional tactics kept his opponent, Boris Spassky, in a state of disarray. Likewise, unpredictability can be advantageous in any competitive environment, making foes second-guess their strategies. Ultimately, understanding when and how to be unpredictable can give you the strategic edge needed for success.

slides.section_body: Unpredictability can be a powerful tool for maintaining control over others. It induces a sense of terror and confusion, keeping opponents off-balance. By cultivating an air of unpredictability, you can create an advantage in any situation.
slides.quote: Nothing is more terrifying than the sudden and unpredictable.

slides.section_body: Humans thrive on habit and predictability, seeking comfort in familiar behaviors. By disrupting this routine, you can instill anxiety and confusion in those around you. Your unpredictability becomes a source of power.
slides.quote: Your predictability gives them a sense of control.

slides.section_body: The legendary chess match between Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky illuminates the law of unpredictability. Fischer's erratic behavior and unconventional strategies left Spassky bewildered and ultimately defeated.
Fischer’s deliberate blunders and unpredictability forced Spassky to constantly reassess his strategies. The ability to confuse your opponent can lead to mistakes that you can exploit.
slides.quote: Allowing him nothing predictable to base his strategy on gives you a big advantage.

slides.section_body: Utilizing unpredictability can turn the tables, especially when facing more powerful adversaries. By making unexpected moves, you can incite confusion and hesitation in your opponents.
slides.quote: Always mystify, mislead, and surprise the enemy, if possible.

slides.section_body: Cultivating unpredictability can make others feel as though they have lost control. This psychological tactic has been used by leaders throughout history to maintain dominance and instill fear.
slides.quote: A person of power instills a kind of fear by deliberately unsettling those around him.

slides.section_body: In various domains, from chess to battle, unpredictability can serve as a critical advantage. When your actions defy expectation, opponents stumble in their attempts to strategize or respond.
slides.quote: The best calculation is the absence of calculation.

slides.section_body: While unpredictability can be a boon, creating patterns can also serve your interests. Familiarity can cloak deceptive actions and create opportunities for significant maneuvers.
slides.quote: Sometimes predictability can work in your favor.

slides.section_body: Be cautious—too much unpredictability can portray you as unstable. Effective use of unpredictability demands careful consideration and timing; excessive disruption may wrest control away from you.
slides.quote: Such power should only be used judiciously.

slides.section_body: Incorporating unpredictability into your interactions can enhance your influence. By keeping others guessing, you remain in a position of strength and can maneuver as needed.
slides.quote: Only the terminally subordinate act in a predictable manner.
